articles.title: Apple (AAPL) Faces Google Deal Fallout—Should Investors Be Worried?
articles.content: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is one of the AI Stocks in the Spotlight Today. On July 28, JPMorgan analyst Samik Chatterjee reiterated an “Overweight” rating on the stock as Apple faces potential business impacts from the ongoing Google antitrust case. According to the firm, Apple receives an estimated $28B globally each year from Alphabet for Google traffic […]

articles.title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures rise ahead of key inflation data, with Apple and Amazon to report
articles.content: Wall Street weighed a new trade deal with South Korea and strong earnings from Meta and Microsoft.

articles.title: Bernstein Analyst Sees Upside in Beaten-Down Qualcomm (QCOM)
articles.content: QUALCOMM Incorporated (NASDAQ:QCOM) is one of the AI Stocks in the Spotlight Today. On July 28, Bernstein SocGen Group analyst Stacy Rasgon reiterated an “Outperform” rating on the stock with a $185.00 price target. The firm believes that QCOM is “heavily out of favor” due to general smartphone market weakness, tariff concerns, and near-term earnings challenges […]

articles.title: Apple & Amazon earnings, PCE, jobless claims: What to Watch
articles.content: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton takes a look at the top stories for investors to watch on Thursday, Jul. 31. Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) will report quarterly earnings results after the markets close. Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) data for June will be released in the morning. Economists are expecting a slight uptick from May. Initial jobless claims data for the week ending Jul. 26 will be out in the morning, as economists expect an increase from the previous week. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

articles.title: Qualcomm Slides After Posting Lackluster Phone Chip Sales
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Qualcomm Inc., the biggest maker of chips that run smartphones, fell in late trading after reporting lackluster growth in that market, fueling concerns that tariffs will take a toll on the industry. articles.title: Arm’s Earnings Meet Expectations. Why the Stock Is Falling.
articles.content: Shares of Arm Holdings, whose customers include Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, are up over 30% this year.

articles.title: Not Interested in Apple or Amazon: I/O Fund's Kindig
articles.content: Lead Tech Analyst at I/O Fund Beth Kindig says she isn't interested in Apple or Amazon as an AI investor. She explains where she does see potential and why she believes stocks like Arm and Meta are overvalued on "Bloomberg Tech."
